title: "Oh, you're in promos?"
body:
"Here, have some feeders, absolute idiots, some people with a <30% winrate, and one tricks who were autofilled, while the enemy team is made up of premades and people on win streaks!"

... remind me why the fuck we have promos in the first place. 80% a coin toss, 19% team comp, 1% individual skill. What does that prove, exactly?

And then try to tell me that the system doesn't try its hardest to keep you at 50%. I'd love for you to prove that it's just a coincidence.

I just don’t tell anyone that I’m in my promos :) Sometimes it’s helpful to tell people that you’re in your promos but 99% of the time it only makes it worse :/

My favorite is right after load screen, team mate says ‘good luck in promos”, then proceeds to int or afk roam while “lol” in chat whole match. Guess who riot will punish first if you get annoyed. I’ll give you a hint, it is NOT the troll ruining the match.

Well the chat still isn't exact proof that they were trolling, though if they had multiple tears or boots or something, I'd hope Riot would punish them.

Or if their deaths were around equal to the length of the game in minutes (especially with minimal damage to champs).
And thank you for making the point about the failed system. It only ques to chat, NOT (except very rarely) actions that actually ruin the game play.

Well yeah, that's the way it is.  It's a lot easier to keep track of chat than everything else.  Even if they could see someone doing stupid stuff, there is a slim possibility that the person is just bad, having a bad day, etc.

I hate trolls as much as the next guy (maybe more as I play through the game to report them at the end rather than dodge for them), but I wouldn't want innocent people being punished for just being bad.  It would also look bad on Riot and potentially lose them a ton of players (many may just decide to quit rather than fight the punishment/ban).
could very easily look at the number of deaths and location on the map of those deaths to see if they were just running it down mid. If theres 1 death per 2 minutes in the same lane, somethings up.

In slightly less extreme examples, you have snowballed top-lane stereotypes. Where the <We'll say Pantheon> gets a lead, then is able to just tower dive his opponent into oblivion. The only options at that point are to. . .

**a)** Go to lane and scratch up what little CS you can, knowing that your team will flame you for feeding. (Even though death spree mechanics will soon make you less valuable than a minion.)
**b)** Roam to another lane (or jungle) and get accused of trolling.
**c)** Hang out in base and get accused of AFK.

Following that, you have cardboard 7, when kills make the majority of income for each team.

There's also those people who use weird off-builds or non-standard play styles. (I remember when Proxy singed was considered a reportable troll tactic by the community.)

------------

How do you teach an automated system to tell the difference?

I just had to dodge a game  and take a loss to my LP because I had a Garen auto filled support who said they don't care, they're going top.  A Rammus ADC, a Vayne going top with Garen because she was auto filled top, and she only plays Vayne....

There needs to be a system in place, that if 3 / 5 people in the lobby do not want to continue, they should be able to vote to leave the lobby due to trolling - it's wayyyy to common.  So here I am, sitting out for 5 minutes (I'll be sitting out 30 if it happens again, it's a waste of my time to try to play games like this)  because people can troll, with zero consequences.  Also, you can't report them if you leave the lobby, because they don't show up on recent players.  I've had a Janna jg to intentionally troll, but nothing I can do about it cause they "tried" to jg with her...

That's all well and good, but it doesn't answer my question.
Lets assume you get that 3-man veto policy (I won't discuss the dynamics of such a thing right now). You still get in game.

***a)***
Your Yasuo top gets stomped by Riven and now has an average life span of 30 seconds in lane before getting assassinated under turret. Gets jungler's permission to take Krugs/Gromp, just so he can get any gold at all.

***b)***
Your Yasuo is a troll, barely CS's and dives into riven after he gets to lane. Keeps stealing Krugs/Gromp to deny his jungler.

These two scenarios might seem unambiguous to us, but how do you teach an *automated system* to tell the difference? That's the dilemma Riot faces.
it would need to be at least 4/5. 3/5 is way too easy.

I wished individual skill was more important, but as a midlaner, it seems harder to have impact by yourself this season than ever before. I played since season 3 and I honestly can't remember any other time where you just lost 90-95% of games where botlane lost. They can either actually hold to this and remove Ranked Solo, or they can redo the system; they cannot do both without being hypocritical...

Some times your allies or down and/or enemies are up.

The system tries to recalculate value or strength after every match (your MMR). It uses that estimation when creating matches. All that matters to the system is where you were during queue, and whether you won the specific match it put you in. Everything before you queued up is irrelevant.

There are edge case you didnt consider actually.

You can freelose until you reach the lowest mmr ever, let's say it's 0.

Then you keep losing a thousant game at this elo.

Then you start playing seriously, litterally winning every single game : in less than 100 games you'll be diamond, yet your total record would be 100 - 1000 which is a bit less than 10% winrate, yet you are climbing.

There are some other few edge case as well, but what you have to remember is that it's your winrate on your last 50-100 games which is interesting to look at.
